Delegate.definition: a person empowered to act on behalf of another
Delegate.origin: [Medieval Latin delegatus , from Latin, past participle of delegare to appoint, put in charge]

1.definition: to entrust or transfer (as power, authority, or responsibility) to another

sub_terms.a: to transfer (one's contractual duties) to another
sub_terms.b: to empower a body (as an administrative agency) to perform (a governmental function) see also

2.definition: to appoint as one's representativeto transfer responsibility or authority
